Comprehensive uncertainty calculation for all plot data types

calculateTotalUncertainty.Rd

This function provides a unified framework for calculating uncertainty across different plot data types. It automatically detects the plot data type, preserves existing uncertainty components if present, and calculates missing components as needed.

Usage

calculateTotalUncertainty(
  plot_data,
  map_year,
  map_resolution = 100,
  biome_info = TRUE
)

Arguments

plot_data

A data frame containing plot data

map_year

Numeric value indicating the map year for temporal adjustment

map_resolution

Numeric value indicating the map resolution in meters (default: 100)

biome_info

Logical indicating whether to use biome information for growth uncertainty (default: TRUE)

Value

A list containing:

data

The plot data with calculated uncertainty components

plot_type

The detected plot data type

uncertainty_components

The relative contribution of each uncertainty component

Examples

# Create a sample dataset of 10 plots:
set.seed(42)
sampled_plots <- plots[sample(nrow(plots), 10), ]
# For non-tree level data
sampled_plots2 <- BiomePair(sampled_plots)
print(sampled_plots2)
#>    PLOT_ID  AGB_T_HA AVG_YEAR SIZE_HA     POINT_X   POINT_Y      ZONE
#> 1     AUS1  53.69000     2004   0.160 145.8683679 -20.69546 Australia
#> 2      EU1  67.79700     2008   0.015  15.2187262  59.81792    Europe
#> 3      EU2  87.87177     2001   0.196   1.3059145  42.59214    Europe
#> 4      EU2  94.59592     2007   0.196  -7.1823899  37.34714    Europe
#> 5      EU2  45.56841     2007   0.196  -7.2162433  37.34765    Europe
#> 6      EU2  58.63558     2006   0.196  -1.0662342  39.61600    Europe
#> 7      EU2  37.31206     2004   0.196  -5.1210978  40.02713    Europe
#> 8      EU2  46.49786     2000   0.196  -3.9889352  40.33963    Europe
#> 9      EU2 150.97321     2004   0.196  -0.1585048  42.63245    Europe
#> 10     EU2  55.14102     2003   0.196  -2.7070556  42.68534    Europe
#>                    FAO.ecozone         GEZ
#> 1           Tropical shrubland    Tropical
#> 2     Boreal coniferous forest      Boreal
#> 3    Temperate mountain system   Temperate
#> 4       Subtropical dry forest Subtropical
#> 5       Subtropical dry forest Subtropical
#> 6       Subtropical dry forest Subtropical
#> 7       Subtropical dry forest Subtropical
#> 8       Subtropical dry forest Subtropical
#> 9    Temperate mountain system   Temperate
#> 10 Subtropical mountain system Subtropical

uncertainty_results <- calculateTotalUncertainty(sampled_plots2, 2020, 100)
#> Calculating tree measurement uncertainty using RF model
#> Error in value[[3L]](cond): Error loading or using RF model: The ranger package is needed but not installed
print(uncertainty_results)
#> Error: object 'uncertainty_results' not found

# For tree-level data with sdTree already calculated
plots_tree <- sd_tree(plotTree, xyTree, "Asia")
#> Error in h(simpleError(msg, call)): error in evaluating the argument 'x' in selecting a method for function 'subset': object 'plotTree' not found
uncertainty_results <- calculateTotalUncertainty(plots_tree, 2020, 100)
#> Error: object 'plots_tree' not found
